required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COM902 (A TIGIT Inhibitor) in Subjects With Advanced Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study of The Safety and Tolerability of COM902 in Subjects With Advanced Malignancies

brief_summary.textblock: Phase 1 open label sequential dose escalation and cohort expansion study evaluating the safety, tolerability and preliminary clinical activity of COM902 as monotherapy in subjects with advanced malignancies.

primary_outcome.measure: The safety and tolerability of COM902 monotherapy.
primary_outcome.time_frame: DLT evaluation window in the 1st cycle (21 Days).
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of subjects with Adverse Events (AEs) as per CTCAE v5.0 and Dose-Limiting Toxicities (DLTs).

primary_outcome.measure: To identify the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and/or recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D).
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of preliminary antitumor activity of COM902.

primary_outcome.measure: To characterize the pharmacokinetic (PK) profile of COM902 as monotherapy in subjects with advanced malignancies.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of parameters of COM902 exposure such as Maximum Plasma Concentration [Cmax]) of COM902.

primary_outcome.measure: To characterize the pharmacokinetic (PK) profile of COM902 as monotherapy in subjects with advanced malignancies.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of parameters of COM902 exposure such as Area under the curve (AUC).

secondary_outcome.measure: To characterize immunogenicity of COM902 monotherapy
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of anti drug antibody to COM902.

arm_group.description: Monotherapy Dose Escalation. COM902 monotherapy administered IV every 3 weeks in sequential dose escalation Cohorts using a rules-based design. Up to 7 dose escalation cohorts may be evaluated until a maximum tolerated dose or recommended phase 2 dose is identified.

intervention.description: COM902 monotherapy administered IV Q3 weeks in sequential dose escalation doses in cohorts of subjects.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with histologically/cytologically confirmed advanced malignancy (solid tumor) who must have exhausted all available standard therapy; or not a candidate for standard therapy.
- Subject is able to provide written, informed consent before initiation of any study related procedures, and is able, in the opinion of the investigator, to comply with all the requirements of the study.
- Subject has Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0-1.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior treatment with a TIGIT inhibitor.
- Symptomatic interstitial lung disease or inflammatory pneumonitis.
- History of immune-related events that required immunotherapy treatment discontinuation.

facility.name: The START Center for Cancer Care.
